intro: Stigmatodactylus confusus, commonly known as the confused stigmatodactyl, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Stigmatodactylus confusus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
